metadata.title: CVE-2018-20548 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
There is an illegal WRITE memory access at common-image.c (functionload_image) in libcaca 0.99.beta19 for 1bpp data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20548` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

caca-utils - 0.99.beta19-2ubuntu0.16.04.1
libcaca0 - 0.99.beta19-2ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libcaca package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.99.beta19-2ubuntu0.16.04.1').
